casebody.data:
Pooley-Hercz Company, Defendant in Error, v. Greene’s Limited, Plaintiff in Error.Gen. No. 21,243.

(Not to be reported in full.)

Error to the Municipal Court of Chicago; the Hon. John C. Wobk, Judge, presiding. Heard in the Branch Appellate Court at the October term, 1915.Affirmed.Opinion filed December 13, 1916.Rehearing denied December 27, 1916.

Statement of the Case.

Action by Pooley-Hercz Company, a corporation, against Greene’s Limited, a corporation, defendant, to recover compensation for the preparation of architect’s "drawings. To review a judgment for plaintiff, defendant prosecutes a writ of error.

M. E. Gallion, for plaintiff in error.No appearance for defendant in error.Abstract of the Decision.Architects and engineers, § 16*—when evidence shows a contract to pay for architect’s drawings. In an action for compensation for the preparation of architect’s drawings, plans and specifications by the plaintiff for the defendant at the latter’s request, evidence held to show an agreement by the defendant to pay therefor and to justify a judgment for the plaintiff.

See Illinois Notes Digest, Vola. XI to XV, and Cumulative Quarterly, same topic and section number.

 Mr. Justice Taylor

delivered the opinion of the court.
